objective: Hello! I am Johannes, a passionate software developer and engineer. I completed my dual studies at [Geberit](https://geberit.com) and am now advancing my expertise by pursuing a Master's in Software Engineering in Konstanz, Germany. Since February, I have been writing my thesis at [Siemens Logistics](https://www.siemens-logistics.com/). In addition, I work as a freelance developer and consultant for various companies and realize my own side projects in my favorite topics of software engineering.

education.thesis: Zentrale Plattform f√ºr die Analyse und Verwaltung der Code-Sicherheit in Unternehmenssoftwaresystemen

entities: Leadership Qualities ("You take on a very central role in planning and team communication")
Customer Orientation ("Your comprehensible and positive interaction with the CPOs is striking in a positive sense")
Communication Skills ("You communicate with great commitment and authenticity")

infos: Writing my master's thesis in the field of airport sort allocation optimization
Among others, worked for Geberit and Westermann Verlag.
Mostly combining open-source technologies and SAP infrastructure for innovative employee applications
Visited all IT departments of the company
Stay abroad to work in a Geberit subsidiary in Italy for several months
Worked on real projects in an international business environment
Developed a full-stack application for security checks used in production

projects.name: Know Where You Go
projects.description: Open-source Google Maps Alternative built with React and Leaflet.

projects.name: Geberit: Central Platform for Analysis of Code Security in Enterprise Software Systems
projects.description: Full-stack cloud native application for security analysis of [ABAP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ABAP) code. Presented on ABAPConf 2023 ([YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/live/hleq0-NTVQo?si=9nZnpXVj0ss_TG6l&t=23324)).

projects.name: Reveal the World: Cloud Native Travel Map App
projects.description: A Web-App with Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform and Express made for running on Azure

projects.name: User Authentication using Voice Recognition
projects.description: A student research project concerning the topic of user authentication using voice recognition. The aim of the work was to find the optimal combination of the speaker features LPC, LPCC, MFCC and Delta MFCC for authentication using a neural network (TensorFlow).

projects.name: Generalized Iterative Closest Point Implementation
projects.description: Own implementation of the Generalized Iterative Closest Point (GICP) algorithm in Python for vizualization and evaluation of the algorithm. The algorithm is finds the optimal transformation between two point clouds and is used to localize a robot using lidar data.

projects.name: Typst MCP Server
projects.description: A MCP server implementation that helps large language model agents to generate Typst documents.

projects.name: HTWG Mobile App
projects.description: Student project in which we develop a mobile app for the students of the University of Applied Sciences Konstanz. Technologies used: Flutter, Quarkus, Docker

projects.name: Resume - All in One and resumee.cloud
projects.description: Open-source resume generator for professionals that allows to define resume data in JSON format and then generates a nice web portfolio and a professional PDF resume. Additionally, I created a SaaS version of the generator at resumee.cloud, that allows users to create their own online resume without any coding. Technologies used: Next.js, Aceternity UI, Typst, Prisma, tRPC

projects.name: Student Project: Kudo Platform
projects.description: We worked with [Sybit GmbH](https://www.sybit.de/) on a Kudo platform as part of the project for the Master's lectures 'Agile Process Models' and 'Mobile Communication and Collaboration'. I was the product owner of my group and therefore always in contact with the chief product owners.

projects.name: Assembly-Timediff
projects.description: Program that evaluates timestamps, written in assembly x86-64

extracurricularActivities: Playing drums in the Musikkapelle Rulfingen e.V.
otherCommentsForMotivationLetter: experimented with various large language models such as Github Copilot and Llama in terms of development speed and quality
often took the leading role in team projects during my studies
very interested in brand new, evolving technology and development topics
